intro: Helipterum stipitatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Helipterum stipitatum is an erect perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
